intro: Commersonia apella, commonly known as the slender commersonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, often with a distinctive waxy coating. Commersonia apella is known for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
